clinical_study.brief_title: Empowering Girls: Health-seeking Behavior, Staying in School, and Preventing Risky Sex
clinical_study.official_title: Empowering Girls: Health-seeking Behavior, Staying in School and Preventing Risky Sex

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will test the effectiveness of a phone-based big sister/big brother program designed to provide health information and support, reduce school dropouts, and promote safer relationships.
The program's goal is to create a phone-based safe space, to ensure adolescents remained connected with access to support and health information during COVID lockdowns.

primary_outcome.measure: Share of students that have been or are pregnant and/or have dropped out of school
primary_outcome.description: These two outcomes (using school administrative data on whether students have dropped out of school and were pregnant) will be combined into a composite variable equal to 1 if the student has become pregnant and/or has dropped out of school.

primary_outcome.measure: Share of students with the accurate belief that older partners have the highest risk of HIV compared to younger partners.
primary_outcome.description: Indicator variable from the survey question wording: "Who do you think has the highest risk of infecting you with HIV?"

secondary_outcome.measure: Share of students reporting that they make the final decision in their life about visiting a Sexual and reproductive health clinic
secondary_outcome.description: Indicator variable from the survey question response

secondary_outcome.measure: Share of students reporting that if they or their partner were pregnant, they would tell the data collector
secondary_outcome.description: Indicator variable coded 1 if student answered likely or very likely to 'If you were pregnant, how likely would you be to tell me?'

other_outcome.measure: Share of students disclosing personal information to the data collector in the open-ended question at the end of the survey.
Share of female students reporting that they agree or strongly agree with the statement 'If I don't want to hold hands with a guy, I can comfortably refuse to do it'

Share of students listing known support services when asked 'If a friend experienced dating difficulties or violence, do you know any organizations, services or phone numbers you could suggest she contact to get some help if she wanted?'

intervention.description: Weekly health-related SMS messages are provided to adolescents.

intervention.intervention_name: Low tech health Phone + SMS messages
intervention.description: Weekly health-related phone calls plus SMS messages are provided to adolescents.

criteria.textblock:

- Adolescent who provided their phone number to Young 1ove staff when prompted by their school; or their siblings/ other adolescents living in the same household.
- Parents and students consented to participate.
